definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
enough (sufficient)/enough (too much)/(coll.) (before adj.) really/(coll.) to reach by stretching out

sentences.english: Look, isn't this belt just so stylin'?
sentences.chinese: 看，这条皮带有够新潮吧？

sentences.english: When your fastball moves by a foot, that's pretty sexy.
sentences.chinese: 当你的快速球会坠移一呎，真是有够诱惑。

sentences.english: I have enough material to make two dresses.
sentences.chinese: 我有够做两件连衣裙的料子。

sentences.english: May there be enough clouds in your life to make a beautiful sunset.
sentences.chinese: 愿你的生命有够多的云翳，造成一个美丽的黄昏。

sentences.english: Also come with pumpkin soup, taste not bad.
sentences.chinese: 也有一碗南瓜汤，这个不错哦，味道有够。

sentences.english: Sudden feeling their action are very solemn and stirring, has suffices soul-stirringly.
sentences.chinese: 突然感觉自己的举动很悲壮，有够荡气回肠。

sentences.english: It's the lamest thing. I never wanted to be associated with it.
sentences.chinese: 它还真是有够滥的，我再也不想跟它扯上关系。

definition: (interj. of admiration or of disgust)/to click one's tongue/to attempt to (find an opportunity to) speak
indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
interjection or grunt of agreement or recognition (e.g. yes, it's me!)/to sigh
